SENT.plain: The immunoglobulin kappa chain gene of human lymphoma cell line HF-1.3.4 was partially sequenced from the 3' end of the leader exon 2.0 kb downstream
The sequenced stretch of DNA included 1.5 kb of the non-coding JK region 3' to the JK2 element of the mature gene
Among the known VK germline genes the closet relative was KV328, which was 91% homologous to HF-1.3.4
In the 1.5 kb JK region homology with JK allele of Whitehurst et al
(allele 2) was 89%, with the allele of Hieter et al
The vast majority of the differences located in the leader intron, the VJ exon or 0.6 kb 3' to the exon, a localization characteristic of somatic hypermutations of immunoglobulin genes

Another indication that most of the differences observed were due to somatic hypermutations is that the 153 bp stretch of the kappa constant gene (CK) sequenced from the mRNA was 100% homologous with the published CK sequence
The most differences between the JK region sequence and that of Whitehurst et al. probably represent somatic mutations: 43% were transversions, 55% transitions and 2% deletions
In the non-coding JK region transversions of C.G to G.C rather than to A.T were heavily over-represented
This is possibly a feature of B-cell hypermutations in humans and mice
